home.h1: Cultivating openness, collaboration, and community in peer review.
home.value_statement: Pilcrow is an application that facilitates the peer review process for scholarly communications. It is founded on creating supportive experiences for authors, reviewers, and editors, and provides an environment for transparent, collegial, and supportive peer review practice.

editorial_statement.peer_review: Move a piece of scholarship from submission through peer review,
editorial_statement.invite: Invite, manage, and correspond with authors and reviewers.

grant_statement.statement: Pilcrow is a collaboration between {mesh_url} and the {ppj_url} at Michigan State University. The project is supported by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation (Grant #G-1910-07239).

open_source.statement: Pilcrow is an open source project. Documentation can be found at {pilcrow_docs}.

name.label: Publication Name
name.hint: This is the name your publication will be known as across the site.

errors.required: A name is required to create a publication.
errors.NOT_UNIQUE: There is already a publication with this name.

effect.false: Publication will be hidden from search.

is_publicly_visible.hint: Set to publicly visible to allow your publication to be discoverable by all users.

effect.true: Publication is currently open to new submissions.
effect.false: Publication is currently closed to new submissions.

is_accepting_submissions.hint: Set to open to allow submissions for the publication.

home_page_content.label: Home Page
home_page_content.description: Displayed to users who view the home page of your publication.
home_page_content.hint: This is usually a good place to describe your publication's focus, goals, team, etc.

new_submission_content.label: New Submission
new_submission_content.description: Displayed to users when they start the create submission process.
new_submission_content.hint: This is a good place to describe the submission and review process of your publication.

publication.users: Assigned users have special permissions on your publication. A user cannot be both an admin and a editor at the same time.

editors.heading: Editors
editors.description: Editors can perform any action on a submission, including assigning review coordinators. They do not have access to the publication setup pages and cannot change publication settings.
editors.none: An editor is not assigned to this publication.

unassign.error: An error occurred while attempting to unassign an editor.

invite.NOT_UNIQUE: Please select {display_name} from the search results dropdown.
invite.invalid_email: Pleaes provide a valid email address for the user you want to invite as editor.

assign.unauthorized: You are not authorized to assign editors. Please contact your administrator.
assign.no_value: Please provide the username, email, or name of the person you want to assign as editor.
assign.duplicate: {display_name} is already assigned as an editor for this publication.
assign.error: An error occurred while attempting to assign an editor. Is the user already assigned to this publication?

publication_admins.heading: Admins
publication_admins.description: Admins are allowed to access the setup pages for the publication. They can change any setting, perform any action on all submissions, and add/remove users.
publication_admins.none: An administrator is not assigned to this publication.

unassign.error: An error occurred while attempting to unassign an administrator.

invite.NOT_UNIQUE: Please select {display_name} from the search results dropdown.
invite.invalid_email: Pleaes provide a valid email address for the user you want to invite as a publication administrator.

assign.unauthorized: You are not authorized to assign publication administrators. Please contact your administrator.
assign.no_value: Please provide the username, email, or name of the person you want to assign as a publication administrator.
assign.duplicate: {display_name} is already assigned as an administrator for this publication.
assign.error: An error occurred while attempting to assign a publication administrator. Is the user already assigned to this publication?

create.failure: An error occurred while attempting to create the publication.

style_criteria.heading: Style Criteria
style_criteria.body_1: Style criteria are a core component of the Collaborative Community Review process. Your users will associate their comments with one or more of the style criteria you define below. This helps keep the conversation about a submission aligned with your publication's core values and focused on moving a submission through the review process.
style_criteria.body_2: You can define up to six style criteria and your reviewers are able to select multiple criteria when creating a comment. Reviewers are able to bypass the style criteria selection after confirming that their comment doesn't fit any of the options presented.
style_criteria.create: Create style criteria to help your reviewers.
style_criteria.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete {name}?
style_criteria.saveError: There was an error saving. Check the form above for errors.

errors.maxLength: Name cannot be longer than 50 characters.

description.placeholder: Enter an optional description for this style criteria.

errors.maxLength: Description cannot be longer than 4096 characters.

submit.description: Your submission has been created and you can come back to work on it any time.  When you've completed the above items, you'll be able to click "Submit for Review" below to kick off the review process!

statusChanged.close: This submission is closed for review.
